item.description: The fourth in our series of monthly discussions on “The Bible from the Standpoint of Scientific and Historical Analysis” will be held on Saturday, March 20 from 3:00 - 5:00 p.m., in the library at 700 Hartford Turnpike in Hamden. At the end of our last discussion, mention was made of interest in the section of Genesis where the “sons of God looked on the daughters of men and saw that they were fair.” This is but one of many apparent contradictions in Genesis we will visit on this occasion.
item.name: Nephilim, untimely camels, and other anomalies in Genesis
